rundown: 2-6 L vs Houston Astros Bryce Elder: 4.1 innings, 6 earned runs, 10 hits, 1 HR, 7 strikeouts Batters: Matt Olson (2 hits - 4 AB, 1 HR, 1 RBI) Ha-Seong Kim (1 hit - 3 AB, 1 RBI) Jurickson Profar (2 hits - 4 AB) The Braves fell to the Houston Astros with a final score of 2-6. The loss was primarily due to a rough outing from starting pitcher Bryce Elder, who allowed 6 earned runs over 4.1 innings. Despite the defeat, the Braves managed to score 2 runs, but it wasn't enough to keep pace with the Astros' offense. Key highlights from the game include: 1. Matt Olson hit a home run and contributed 2 hits, driving in 1 run. 2. Bryce Elder struck out 7 batters, showcasing his ability to miss bats despite the runs allowed. 3. Jurickson Profar and Ha-Seong Kim both had solid performances at the plate, combining for 3 hits.
